text: The study population comprised 1455 individuals ( 931 female and 524 male ) with a median age of 51 . 08 years . Based on BMI calculated from self - reported weight and height , 2 . 1 % of the population was underweight ( BMI < 18 . 5 kg / m 2 ) , 54 % had a normal weight ( 18 . 5 kg / m 2 ≤ BMI < 25 kg / m 2 ) , 31 . 1 % was overweight , and 12 . 8 % was considered obese ( Table 1 ) . In women , the distribution was 2 . 8 % , 60 . 21 % , 25 . 0 % , and 12 . 1 % and in men 0 . 76 % , 43 . 1 % , 41 . 8 % , and 14 . 3 % , respectively . The study participants were mainly of medium and high educational level , non - or ex - smokers , moderately affected by selected co - morbidities and they reported rather infrequent contact to small children . Further information on the study population and completed diaries is reported in Table 1 and Additional file 4 .
